text: Haberdashers' Boys' School (Habs Boys) is an independent day school for boys aged 4–18, located at Butterfly Lane, Elstree, Hertfordshire, WD6 3AF. Phone: 020 8266 1700. The school sits on a 100-acre co-educational campus shared with Haberdashers' Girls' School. Habs Boys was founded in 1690 by Royal Charter, funded by a bequest from Robert Aske to the Worshipful Company of Haberdashers. The school educates around 1,450 pupils, including approximately 360 in the Prep School. It was named Independent School of the Year 2025 (overall winner) and Independent School of the Year for Outstanding Educational Partnerships. The school motto is "Together, boundless."

title: School Structure

text:
The Headmaster of Habs Boys is Mr Robert Sykes, who took up the post in 2023. The previous Headmaster, Mr Gus Lock (2018–2023), was appointed Executive Principal of both Haberdashers' Elstree Schools (Habs Boys and Habs Girls) in 2023. Mr Lock has strategic responsibility for both schools on the Elstree campus. The Head reports to the Executive Principal and is a core member of the campus leadership team, working alongside the Girls' School Head and the COO.

Gus Lock is a former Habs Boys pupil and Old Haberdashers alumnus who studied Ancient and Modern History at Exeter College, Oxford. He previously served as Headmaster of Warwick School (2013–2018).

The Director of Marketing, Communications and Admissions is Avril Tooley. The Admissions Registrar is Binnur Rogers. Admissions team members include Chantal Gilbert and Jennifer Adams (Assistant Registrar).
title: Leadership

text:
The school's vision is to be at the forefront of education. Its mission is to offer outstanding education that is fun, exciting and intellectually challenging on a co-educational campus, developing independence, resilience and a moral compass. Its purpose is to empower young people to make a profound impact in the world.

The four core values are: Ambitious (bold, challenging the status quo, selfless lever for change), Curious (questioning, creative, bringing awe and wonder to learning), Courageous (exploring beyond comfort zones, resilient, unflinching problem-solvers), and Community (caring, respectful, inclusive, celebrating differences, locally and globally focused).

text:
Ambitious, challenging, exciting curriculum with expert teachers. Active, independent learning through practical tasks, discussion, and debate. Students expected to excel across languages, sciences, maths, athletics, music, performing arts, technology, history, and arts. Not bound by National Curriculum but stays current with developments.

Lower School (Y7–8) transitions to Middle School (Y9–11) then to Sixth Form with bespoke one-to-one guidance at each stage. The school operates a no-phone policy from Years 7–11.

title: House System

text:
Founded 1690 by Royal Charter using a bequest from Robert Aske to the Worshipful Company of Haberdashers. Originally at Hoxton in Shoreditch, the school moved to Hampstead in 1898 and to its current 100-acre site at Elstree in 1961. Aldenham House, a Grade II* listed English country house, became the school's centrepiece. Habs Boys is one of 11 schools around the country owned by the Haberdashers' Company.

In 2021, Robert Aske's name was dropped from the school following the discovery of his links with the Royal African Company and the slave trade. The motto was changed from "Serve and Obey" to "Together, boundless." The Hinton and Taylor buildings, comprising 46 classrooms, academic offices, and a drama studio, were completed in 2022.
title: History

text:
The school follows a 10-year "Profound Impact" strategy (published September 2022), uniting Habs Boys and Habs Girls under a shared vision of single-sex education on a co-educational campus. Six strategic aims: Learning, Caring, Exploring, Partnerships, Talent, Campus.

Part of the Haberdashers' Company and Schools. Member of ISI (Independent Schools Inspectorate), HMC (Headmasters' and Headmistresses' Conference), ISC (Independent Schools Council), GSA, IAPS, ISBA, AGBIS. Two schools have recently joined the Haberdashers' Elstree family: Lochinver House School (from September 2025), and St Martin's School, Northwood (joining from April 2026).
